data.title: State-Specific ACA Reporting (DC, NJ, CA, RI)
data.text:
Confirming Your State IDs

When filing state-specific reporting, the relevant state IDs are required. By default, the state IDs reported are defined in the jurisdiction settings.

To confirm your State IDs:

Go to Setup > Payroll > Setup Tasks > Set Up Payroll.

If you have a NetSuite OneWorld account, select the subsidiary from the Subsidiary list.

Click the Jurisdictions subtab.

Click the subtab for the four mandated states:

For the District of Columbia, the State ID is sourced from the OTR Account Number.

For New Jersey, the State ID is sourced from the Taxpayer Identification Number.

For California, the State ID is sourced from the ALE Memberâs FEIN.

For Rhode Island, the State ID is sourced from the ALE Memberâs FEIN.

Note:

If an employee earned income in DC in any month, they are considered a resident of DC for that month for ACA reporting purposes. This is true even if they resided in another state.

If you do not configure the states in the jurisdiction settings, NetSuite uses the Employer Identification Number (EIN) in the Company and Subsidiary settings.

Viewing and Editing an Employeeâs State History

The state history records an employeeâs residence in the four mandated states (DC, NJ, CA, and RI). If an employee moved into or out of a mandated state during a month, they are considered as residents of that state during that month.

When you install or update the ACA SuiteApp, the employeesâ state histories are generated from the system notes on the employee record. Subsequently, when you edit an employeeâs address on the employee record, their state history is updated.

To view or edit an employeeâs state history:

Go to Payroll and HR > Lists > Employees (Payroll Manager).

On the Employees list, click Edit next to the employee whose state history you want to view.

Click the Affordable Care Act (ACA) subtab.

Click the State History subtab.

If you need to correct information in the state history, click the row of the field you want to edit.

For each time period when the employee resided in a mandated state, enter the State, Start Month, Start Year, End Month, and End Year. To indicate that you manually edited the state history, check the Is Manually Added box.

Click Save.
